page.title: 06The School in the Past
page.content: {Auchterhouse School}was built in 1926. The first Headteacher or Dominie at the school was{Mr. Ramsay.}On the first day there were only 59 pupils present out of the 72 on the roll. Apparently there was an outbreak of whooping cough. Most pupils had to walk two or three miles to school because they came from distant farms. There were only twenty houses in the village. School started at 9:30 am, because of the distance many of the pupils had to walk, and finished at 4:00 pm.The toilets were outside. There was, in front of the school, a wall from the school down to the end of the playground dividing the girls' side from the boys' side. There are two people in{Auchterhouse}who were at school when it first opened. Pupils started at five years of age and continued until they were fourteen.
